We appreciate your interest in Theatre Camp. Due to the increase in the number of students at BYU-Idaho, our department resources are being reassigned to other areas. We will no longer be able to offer many of the programs that we used to provide.  Read Letter to the Community for more information.

We would like to thank you for your past support of our programs. We have had many enjoyable years and appreciate the contributions and value that you brought to our programs. If you are still interested in this type of program, we suggest that you look for other alternatives provided by BYU-Idaho or the community.

Theatre Camp

Information Packet

The Theatre Summer Camp will be an excellent opportunity for youth to explore their talents and their ability to express themselves under the helpful guidance of BYU-Idaho theatre students. Different workshops will be held on the fundamentals of theatre production. Participants will audition, rehearse, and perform as part of their experience.

Theatre Summer Camp will provide participants with a well-rounded BYU-Idaho experience while helping them develop their theatrical talent. They will see how theatre and the gospel coexist, having the capacity to bless their lives and the lives of those around them.

Attending Theatre Summer Camp at BYU-Idaho provides the opportunity to learn and grow in a gospel-centered atmosphere. Participants will showcase their skills at the end of the week in a revue-style performance for their friends and family. Theatre Summer Camp is an opportunity to make new friends and grow as a theatre artist in unique ways.

Your experience as a participant depends upon how much you put into it. Be sure to prepare for the Theatre Summer Camp and commit to following the honor code and other guidelines to make sure you have the best experience possible.

  • BYU-Idaho student mentoring
  • Acting and tech workshops
  • "Zombie Prombie" theatre-themed dance
  • Stage makeup
  • Improv show
  • Mystery dinner

Who: Youth ages 14-18.

Note: Counselors and instructors are selected from BYU-Idaho students. Participants will be expected to abide by the BYU-Idaho Honor Code.

Actors are beings who have tasted life's nectar in that crystal moment when they poured out their creative spirit and touched another's heart.

~David Ackert
